Description: The Delaware City Refining Company will pay a $73,113 penalty to settle alleged violations of federal environmental regulations for failing to immediately notify the National Response Center and state and local emergency planning agencies about the release of hazardous substances that exceeded reportable quantities into the environment on two separate dates.
Agency: Environmental Protection Agency
Info Source: https://archive.epa.gov/epa/newsreleases/epa-delaware-city-refining-company-settle-environmental-violations.html

Agency: Federal Railroad Administration
Info Source: https://www.fra.dot.gov/eLib/details/L17311#p1_z5_gD_lEA

Agency: Federal Railroad Administration
Info Source: https://www.fra.dot.gov/eLib/details/L04899#p1_z5_gD_lEA

Description: In 2005 Premcor Refining, then the owner of the Delaware City Refinery, agreed to spend $7.5 million on improved environmental controls. At the same time, Motiva Enterprises, which owned the facility at the time of a catastrophic explosion in 2001, agreed to pay a $12 million civil penalty, spend $4 million on supplementary environmental projects and reimburse public agencies for $170,000 in response costs. The refinery was later sold to PBF Energy.
Agency: Justice Department Environment and Natural Resources Division
Info Source: https://www.justice.gov/archive/opa/pr/2005/September/05_enrd_488.html

Agency: Federal Railroad Administration
Info Source: https://www.fra.dot.gov/eLib/details/L17311#p1_z5_gD_lEA

Agency: Delaware Department of Natural Resources and Environmental Control
Info Source: http://www.dnrec.delaware.gov/Info/Documents/20190711-dcrc-air-quality-settlement-agreement.pdf

Description: Delaware City Refining Company was issued an administrative penalty of $118,000 with a cost recovery of $7,433. DCRC was approved to offset $88,000 of the penalty for an EIP that was approved by DNREC. DCRC must remit payment of $30,000 for penalty payment, $7,888 for cost recovery payment, and provide proof of a minimum of $88,000 for the EIP.
Agency: Delaware Department of Natural Resources and Environmental Control
Info Source: http://www.nav.dnrec.delaware.gov/DEN3/Detail/EnforcementDetail.aspx?id=12408

Agency: Delaware Department of Natural Resources and Environmental Control
Info Source: http://www.dnrec.delaware.gov/Info/Documents/Secretarys-Order-No-2017-A-0009.pdf

Description: Chalmette Refining agreed to pay $100,000 and spend $641,000 on environmental projects as civil penalties in settlement of multiple violations of emission limits, failures to monitor or report emissions, and equipment not operated as required by permits.
Agency: Louisiana Department of Environmental Quality
Info Source: https://deq.louisiana.gov/assets/docs/General/Settlement_Agreements/2018/Chalmette0038.pdf
